line: Well mock'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Merchant
line: No, my good lord; he speaks the common tongue,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Merchant
line: Which all men speak with him.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Look, who comes here: will you be chid?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Jeweller
line: We'll bear, with your lordship.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Merchant
line: He'll spare none.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Good morrow to thee, gentle Apemantus!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Till I be gentle, stay thou for thy good morrow;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: When thou art Timon's dog, and these knaves honest.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Why dost thou call them knaves? thou know'st them not.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Are they not Athenians?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Yes.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Then I repent not.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Jeweller
line: You know me, Apemantus?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Thou know'st I do: I call'd thee by thy name.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Thou art proud, Apemantus.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Of nothing so much as that I am not like Timon.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Whither art going?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: To knock out an honest Athenian's brains.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: That's a deed thou'lt die for.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Right, if doing nothing be death by the law.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: How likest thou this picture, Apemantus?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: The best, for the innocence.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Wrought he not well that painted it?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: He wrought better that made the painter; and yet

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: he's but a filthy piece of work.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Painter
line: You're a dog.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Thy mother's of my generation: what's she, if I be a dog?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Wilt dine with me, Apemantus?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: No; I eat not lords.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: An thou shouldst, thou 'ldst anger ladies.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: O, they eat lords; so they come by great bellies.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: That's a lascivious apprehension.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: So thou apprehendest it: take it for thy labour.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: How dost thou like this jewel, Apemantus?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Not so well as plain-dealing, which will not cost a

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: man a doit.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: What dost thou think 'tis worth?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Not worth my thinking. How now, poet!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Poet
line: How now, philosopher!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Thou liest.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Poet
line: Art not one?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Yes.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Poet
line: Then I lie not.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Art not a poet?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Poet
line: Yes.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Then thou liest: look in thy last work, where thou

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: hast feigned him a worthy fellow.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Poet
line: That's not feigned; he is so.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Yes, he is worthy of thee, and to pay thee for thy

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: labour: he that loves to be flattered is worthy o'

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: the flatterer. Heavens, that I were a lord!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: What wouldst do then, Apemantus?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: E'en as Apemantus does now; hate a lord with my heart.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: What, thyself?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Ay.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Wherefore?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: That I had no angry wit to be a lord.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Art not thou a merchant?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Merchant
line: Ay, Apemantus.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Traffic confound thee, if the gods will not!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Merchant
line: If traffic do it, the gods do it.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Traffic's thy god; and thy god confound thee!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: What trumpet's that?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Messenger
line: 'Tis Alcibiades, and some twenty horse,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Messenger
line: All of companionship.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Pray, entertain them; give them guide to us.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: You must needs dine with me: go not you hence

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Till I have thank'd you: when dinner's done,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Show me this piece. I am joyful of your sights.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Most welcome, sir!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: So, so, there!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Aches contract and starve your supple joints!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: That there should be small love 'mongst these

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: sweet knaves,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: And all this courtesy! The strain of man's bred out

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Into baboon and monkey.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: ALCIBIADES
line: Sir, you have saved my longing, and I feed

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: ALCIBIADES
line: Most hungerly on your sight.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Right welcome, sir!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Ere we depart, we'll share a bounteous time

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: In different pleasures. Pray you, let us in.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: What time o' day is't, Apemantus?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Time to be honest.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: That time serves still.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: The more accursed thou, that still omitt'st it.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Thou art going to Lord Timon's feast?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Ay, to see meat fill knaves and wine heat fools.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Fare thee well, fare thee well.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Thou art a fool to bid me farewell twice.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Why, Apemantus?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Shouldst have kept one to thyself, for I mean to

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: give thee none.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: Hang thyself!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: No, I will do nothing at thy bidding: make thy

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: requests to thy friend.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Away, unpeaceable dog, or I'll spurn thee hence!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: I will fly, like a dog, the heels o' the ass.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: He's opposite to humanity. Come, shall we in,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: And taste Lord Timon's bounty? he outgoes

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: The very heart of kindness.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: He pours it out; Plutus, the god of gold,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Is but his steward: no meed, but he repays

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Sevenfold above itself; no gift to him,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: But breeds the giver a return exceeding

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: All use of quittance.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: The noblest mind he carries

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: That ever govern'd man.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Long may he live in fortunes! Shall we in?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: I'll keep you company.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: VENTIDIUS
line: Most honour'd Timon,

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: VENTIDIUS
line: It hath pleased the gods to remember my father's age,

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: VENTIDIUS
line: And call him to long peace.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: VENTIDIUS
line: He is gone happy, and has left me rich:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: VENTIDIUS
line: Then, as in grateful virtue I am bound

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: VENTIDIUS
line: To your free heart, I do return those talents,

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: VENTIDIUS
line: Doubled with thanks and service, from whose help

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: VENTIDIUS
line: I derived liberty.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: O, by no means,

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Honest Ventidius; you mistake my love:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: I gave it freely ever; and there's none

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Can truly say he gives, if he receives:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: If our betters play at that game, we must not dare

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: To imitate them; faults that are rich are fair.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: VENTIDIUS
line: A noble spirit!

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Nay, my lords,

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Ceremony was but devised at first

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: To set a gloss on faint deeds, hollow welcomes,

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Recanting goodness, sorry ere 'tis shown;

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: But where there is true friendship, there needs none.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Pray, sit; more welcome are ye to my fortunes

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Than my fortunes to me.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: My lord, we always have confess'd it.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Ho, ho, confess'd it! hang'd it, have you not?

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: O, Apemantus, you are welcome.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: No;

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: You shall not make me welcome:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: I come to have thee thrust me out of doors.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Fie, thou'rt a churl; ye've got a humour there

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Does not become a man: 'tis much to blame.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: They say, my lords, 'ira furor brevis est;' but yond

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: man is ever angry. Go, let him have a table by

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: himself, for he does neither affect company, nor is

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: he fit for't, indeed.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Let me stay at thine apperil, Timon: I come to

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: observe; I give thee warning on't.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: I take no heed of thee; thou'rt an Athenian,

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: therefore welcome: I myself would have no power;

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: prithee, let my meat make thee silent.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: I scorn thy meat; 'twould choke me, for I should

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: ne'er flatter thee. O you gods, what a number of

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: men eat Timon, and he sees 'em not! It grieves me

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: to see so many dip their meat in one man's blood;

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: and all the madness is, he cheers them up too.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: I wonder men dare trust themselves with men:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Methinks they should invite them without knives;

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Good for their meat, and safer for their lives.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: There's much example for't; the fellow that sits

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: next him now, parts bread with him, pledges the

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: breath of him in a divided draught, is the readiest

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: man to kill him: 't has been proved. If I were a

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: huge man, I should fear to drink at meals;

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Lest they should spy my windpipe's dangerous notes:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Great men should drink with harness on their throats.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: My lord, in heart; and let the health go round.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Let it flow this way, my good lord.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Flow this way! A brave fellow! he keeps his tides

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: well. Those healths will make thee and thy state

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: look ill, Timon. Here's that which is too weak to

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: be a sinner, honest water, which ne'er left man i' the mire:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: This and my food are equals; there's no odds:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Feasts are too proud to give thanks to the gods.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Apemantus' grace.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Immortal gods, I crave no pelf;

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: I pray for no man but myself:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Grant I may never prove so fond,

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: To trust man on his oath or bond;

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Or a harlot, for her weeping;

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Or a dog, that seems a-sleeping:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Or a keeper with my freedom;

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Or my friends, if I should need 'em.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Amen. So fall to't:

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Rich men sin, and I eat root.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Much good dich thy good heart, Apemantus!

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: Captain Alcibiades, your heart's in the field now.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: ALCIBIADES
line: My heart is ever at your service, my lord.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: You had rather be at a breakfast of enemies than a

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: TIMON
line: dinner of friends.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: ALCIBIADES
line: So the were bleeding-new, my lord, there's no meat

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: ALCIBIADES
line: like 'em: I could wish my best friend at such a feast.

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS
line: Would all those fatterers were thine enemies then,

scene: SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
speaker: APEMANTUS

line: Nay, let's seek him:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: Then do we sin against our own estate,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: When we may profit meet, and come too late.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: True;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: When the day serves, before black-corner'd night,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: Find what thou want'st by free and offer'd light. Come.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Aside  I'll meet you at the turn. What a

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: god's gold,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: That he is worshipp'd in a baser temple

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Than where swine feed!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: 'Tis thou that rigg'st the bark and plough'st the foam,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Settlest admired reverence in a slave:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: To thee be worship! and thy saints for aye

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Be crown'd with plagues that thee alone obey!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Fit I meet them.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: Hail, worthy Timon!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: Our late noble master!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Have I once lived to see two honest men?

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: Sir,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: Having often of your open bounty tasted,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: Hearing you were retired, your friends fall'n off,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: Whose thankless natures--O abhorred spirits!--

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: Not all the whips of heaven are large enough:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: What! to you,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: Whose star-like nobleness gave life and influence

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: To their whole being! I am rapt and cannot cover

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: The monstrous bulk of this ingratitude

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: With any size of words.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Let it go naked, men may see't the better:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: You that are honest, by being what you are,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Make them best seen and known.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: He and myself

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: Have travail'd in the great shower of your gifts,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: And sweetly felt it.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Ay, you are honest men.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: We are hither come to offer you our service.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Most honest men! Why, how shall I requite you?

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Can you eat roots, and drink cold water? no.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Both
line: What we can do, we'll do, to do you service.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Ye're honest men: ye've heard that I have gold;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: I am sure you have: speak truth; ye're honest men.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: So it is said, my noble lord; but therefore

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: Came not my friend nor I.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Good honest men! Thou draw'st a counterfeit

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Best in all Athens: thou'rt, indeed, the best;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Thou counterfeit'st most lively.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: So, so, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: E'en so, sir, as I say. And, for thy fiction,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Why, thy verse swells with stuff so fine and smooth

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: That thou art even natural in thine art.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: But, for all this, my honest-natured friends,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: I must needs say you have a little fault:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Marry, 'tis not monstrous in you, neither wish I

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: You take much pains to mend.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Both
line: Beseech your honour

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Both
line: To make it known to us.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: You'll take it ill.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Both
line: Most thankfully, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Will you, indeed?

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Both
line: Doubt it not, worthy lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: There's never a one of you but trusts a knave,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: That mightily deceives you.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Both
line: Do we, my lord?

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Ay, and you hear him cog, see him dissemble,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Know his gross patchery, love him, feed him,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Keep in your bosom: yet remain assured

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: That he's a made-up villain.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Painter
line: I know none such, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Poet
line: Nor I.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Look you, I love you well; I'll give you gold,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Rid me these villains from your companies:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Hang them or stab them, drown them in a draught,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Confound them by some course, and come to me,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: I'll give you gold enough.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Both
line: Name them, my lord, let's know them.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: You that way and you this, but two in company;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Each man apart, all single and alone,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Yet an arch-villain keeps him company.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: If where thou art two villains shall not be,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Come not near him. If thou wouldst not reside

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: But where one villain is, then him abandon.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Hence, pack! there's gold; you came for gold, ye slaves:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: You have work'd for me; there's payment for you: hence!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: You are an alchemist; make gold of that.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Out, rascal dogs!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: It is in vain that you would speak with Timon;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: For he is set so only to himself

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: That nothing but himself which looks like man

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: Is friendly with him.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: Bring us to his cave:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: It is our part and promise to the Athenians

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: To speak with Timon.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: At all times alike

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Men are not still the same: 'twas time and griefs

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: That framed him thus: time, with his fairer hand,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Offering the fortunes of his former days,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: The former man may make him. Bring us to him,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: And chance it as it may.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: Here is his cave.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: Peace and content be here! Lord Timon! Timon!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: Look out, and speak to friends: the Athenians,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: By two of their most reverend senate, greet thee:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: Speak to them, noble Timon.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Thou sun, that comfort'st, burn! Speak, and

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: be hang'd:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: For each true word, a blister! and each false

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Be as cauterizing to the root o' the tongue,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Consuming it with speaking!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: Worthy Timon,--

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Of none but such as you, and you of Timon.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: The senators of Athens greet thee, Timon.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: I thank them; and would send them back the plague,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Could I but catch it for them.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: O, forget

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: What we are sorry for ourselves in thee.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: The senators with one consent of love

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: Entreat thee back to Athens; who have thought

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: On special dignities, which vacant lie

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: For thy best use and wearing.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: They confess

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Toward thee forgetfulness too general, gross:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Which now the public body, which doth seldom

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Play the recanter, feeling in itself

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: A lack of Timon's aid, hath sense withal

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Of its own fail, restraining aid to Timon;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: And send forth us, to make their sorrow'd render,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Together with a recompense more fruitful

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Than their offence can weigh down by the dram;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Ay, even such heaps and sums of love and wealth

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: As shall to thee blot out what wrongs were theirs

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: And write in thee the figures of their love,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Ever to read them thine.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: You witch me in it;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Surprise me to the very brink of tears:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Lend me a fool's heart and a woman's eyes,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: And I'll beweep these comforts, worthy senators.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: Therefore, so please thee to return with us

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: And of our Athens, thine and ours, to take

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: The captainship, thou shalt be met with thanks,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: Allow'd with absolute power and thy good name

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: Live with authority: so soon we shall drive back

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: Of Alcibiades the approaches wild,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: Who, like a boar too savage, doth root up

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: His country's peace.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: And shakes his threatening sword

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: Against the walls of Athens.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: Therefore, Timon,--

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Well, sir, I will; therefore, I will, sir; thus:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: If Alcibiades kill my countrymen,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Let Alcibiades know this of Timon,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: That Timon cares not. But if be sack fair Athens,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: And take our goodly aged men by the beards,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Giving our holy virgins to the stain

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Of contumelious, beastly, mad-brain'd war,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Then let him know, and tell him Timon speaks it,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: In pity of our aged and our youth,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: I cannot choose but tell him, that I care not,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: And let him take't at worst; for their knives care not,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: While you have throats to answer: for myself,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: There's not a whittle in the unruly camp

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: But I do prize it at my love before

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: The reverend'st throat in Athens. So I leave you

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: To the protection of the prosperous gods,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: As thieves to keepers.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: Stay not, all's in vain.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Why, I was writing of my epitaph;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: it will be seen to-morrow: my long sickness

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Of health and living now begins to mend,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: And nothing brings me all things. Go, live still;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Be Alcibiades your plague, you his,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: And last so long enough!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: We speak in vain.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: But yet I love my country, and am not

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: One that rejoices in the common wreck,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: As common bruit doth put it.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: That's well spoke.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Commend me to my loving countrymen,--

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: These words become your lips as they pass

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: thorough them.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: And enter in our ears like great triumphers

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: Second Senator
line: In their applauding gates.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Commend me to them,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: And tell them that, to ease them of their griefs,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Their fears of hostile strokes, their aches, losses,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Their pangs of love, with other incident throes

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: That nature's fragile vessel doth sustain

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: In life's uncertain voyage, I will some kindness do them:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: I'll teach them to prevent wild Alcibiades' wrath.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: I like this well; he will return again.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: I have a tree, which grows here in my close,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: That mine own use invites me to cut down,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: And shortly must I fell it: tell my friends,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Tell Athens, in the sequence of degree

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: From high to low throughout, that whoso please

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: To stop affliction, let him take his haste,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Come hither, ere my tree hath felt the axe,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: And hang himself. I pray you, do my greeting.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: FLAVIUS
line: Trouble him no further; thus you still shall find him.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Come not to me again: but say to Athens,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Timon hath made his everlasting mansion

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Upon the beached verge of the salt flood;

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Who once a day with his embossed froth

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: The turbulent surge shall cover: thither come,

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: And let my grave-stone be your oracle.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Lips, let sour words go by and language end:

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: What is amiss plague and infection mend!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Graves only be men's works and death their gain!

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: TIMON
line: Sun, hide thy beams! Timon hath done his reign.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: His discontents are unremoveably

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
speaker: First Senator
line: Coupled to nature.

scene: SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.
